Owlbear Wrestling.name: Owlbear Wrestling
Owlbear Wrestling.description: You can attempt to grapple creatures two size categories larger than yourself, and you have advantage on grappling checks you make on your turn against creatures that are at least one size category smaller than you.

Mousefolk Lineage.name: Mousefolk Lineage
Mousefolk Lineage.description:
Mousefolk belong to a lineage of mouselings or ratlings. Choose one of the following lineage options:

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.QgVdU4iFKhAPXaDy]{Mouseling’s Sidestep.} When a creature you can see makes an opportunity attack against you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. You can’t use this trait when wearing medium or heavy armor.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.j785Endh4VaJyfwA]{Ratling’s Gnaw.} You can use your action to chew through and break a small nonmagical object that isn’t being worn or carried, like a rope, a wooden rod or handle, or a length of fabric. If you chew on a wooden wall or floor for 1 minute, you can gnaw a hole large enough for a Tiny creature. You can’t chew through materials that are harder than your teeth, such as metal, stone, or crystal.

Sentient Lance.name: Sentient Lance
Sentient Lance.description:
Magic Weapon. The weapon counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage. When you reach 5th level, your bond with the weapon strengthens, and you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. At 11th level, your bond strengthens further, and you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.items-and-spells.Item.yhj7gI0HfsgE6C3m]{Relic Magic.} Your relic weapon has 3 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dawn. When you use the Attack action to make an attack with your relic weapon, you can spend 1 of its charges to make an attack using it as a bonus action.

Additionally, whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can siphon some of the energy into the weapon. The next time you hit a creature with the weapon during the next minute, you deal extra force damage equal to twice the spell’s level.

Sentience. The weapon is a sentient magic item with an alignment and personality determined by the GM. It has an Intelligence of 14, a Wisdom of 14, and a Charisma of 14. The weapon has hearing and darkvision out to a range of 120 feet, and it can speak, read, and understand Common, as well as communicate with you telepathically.

*Foundry Note: the user will have to manually select 'Proficient' on the Proficiency drop down at the top of the Details tab.

Cantrip Savant.name: Cantrip Savant
Cantrip Savant.description: You learn three cantrips of your choice from the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.QvPDSUsAiEn3hD8s.JournalEntryPage.k7Rs5EyXeA0SFTXD]{wizard spell list}. Use your spellcasting ability for these spells.

Spellcasting.name: 施法
Spellcasting.description: This auxiliary level counts as a level in your Spellcasting or Pact Magic class (if you have a level in such a class) for the purpose of determining your available spell slots. However, it doesn’t advance your spells known and prepared. For example, if you are a Wizard 2/Priest, you have four 1st-level spell slots and two 2nd-level spell slots, but you only know 1st-level spells.

Near-Human.name: Near-Human
Near-Human.description:
Humans are known for being ambitious, diverse, and extremely short-lived, but also have the dubious honor of having an abundance of near-human offshoots, for it seems humans can breed with just about anything. Near-humans are still basically humans, bearing subtly different traits from a wide variety of sources, and are individually rare but make up a surprisingly large portion of any human population.

If you choose a human for your race, you can use the following Near-Human variant traits, which replace the human’s Ability Score Increase:

Ability Score Increase. Two different ability scores of your choice increase by 1.

Skills. You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.HnEBSFBs15jbVxix]{Feat.} You gain one feat of your choice. This feat must have Near-Human variant as a prerequisite.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.journals.JournalEntry.Gga9MPWLg4I92JLQ.JournalEntryPage.BBOWl4L3tHn9L02P]{Sidebar: Creating Near-Human Feats}

*Foundry Note: Each Near-Human Feat comes with an additional Ability Score Increase. The extra point is included with the main Ability Score Improvement choice when you pick this race.

Near-Human Feat.title: Near-Human Feat
Near-Human Feat.hint: You gain one feat of your choice. This feat must have Near-Human variant as a prerequisite.

Staggering Strike.name: Staggering Strike
Staggering Strike.description:
As a bonus action when you make a weapon attack against a Large or smaller creature, you can expend a battle die to attempt to daze the target. On a hit, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be incapacitated until the start of your next turn.

*Foundry Note: Default Save DC is Strength, if the user would like to use their Dexterity modifier they will have to change it on the Details Tab.

Master Thrower.name: Master Thrower
Master Thrower.description:
Prerequisite: Dexterity 13

You are an expert in using thrown weapons. You gain the following benefits:

  • When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action to make a ranged attack with a thrown weapon. You don’t add your ability modifier to the damage of the bonus attack, unless that modifier is negative.
  • When you make a ranged weapon attack, you can draw the weapon as part of the attack. You can draw any number of weapons in this fashion each round.
  • The short and long ranges of your thrown weapons double.

Bull Rush.name: Bull Rush
Bull Rush.description:
When you move at least 10 feet in a straight line and immediately make a melee weapon attack against a creature, you can use a bonus action and expend a battle die to shove the target after the attack. Add the battle die to the Strength (Athletics) check you make to shove the target. On a success, you can choose to either knock the target prone or push it up to 10 feet away from you.

*Foundry Note: the user can use the Utility formula from the details tab to calculate the Strength (Athletics) check required in this feature.

Ageless.name: Ageless
Ageless.description: You don’t age, can’t be aged magically, and suffer none of the frailty of old age. You can’t die of old age.

Child.name: Child
Child.description:
You are an adolescent, someone who has absolutely no place in the dangerous adventuring life. Perhaps you are destined to change the world and your destiny will not wait for maturity, or perhaps you have thrown your lot in with an adventuring party who has promised to keep you safe from harm. Somehow, you are at the precipice of adventure, and have the following traits:

  • Your size is Small, even if your race is normally Medium.
  • You have two fewer skill proficiencies than other characters of the same class.
  • Your Strength and Constitution scores have a maximum of 16, instead of 20.
  • You gain proficiency in two saving throws of your choice.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.journals.JournalEntry.1owgaMWM4ifz4txd.JournalEntryPage.WJk1NdaomWdu5dJe]{Sidebar: No Kids Were Harmed in the Making of this Book}

Training.name: Training
Training.description: You gain proficiency with any three simple or martial weapons of your choice. Additionally, you gain proficiency with light armor. If you already have proficiency with light armor, you gain proficiency with medium armor instead.

Gambler.name: Gambler
Gambler.description:
Always keen for probabilities and risk, you often trust your safety and fortune to the hands of fate. You gain the following benefits:

  • You gain proficiency in all gaming sets and have advantage on ability checks you make for games of chance.
  • Once on each of your turns, before you roll damage, you can place stakes on the roll. Choose less than the average, or higher than or equal to the average. Roll damage as normal. If you choose correctly, you can add one extra die of damage to the roll. If you choose incorrectly, you must remove the damage die with the highest number.

Psionics.name: Psionics
Psionics.description:
You know the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Utk1OQRwYkMkFRD3]{mage hand} cantrip, and the hand is invisible when you cast the cantrip with this trait.

Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.ccduLIvutyNqvkgv]{unseen servant} spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.MRxldJd6C4bsBo3O]{levitate} spell with this trait. Once you cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.ccduLIvutyNqvkgv]{unseen servant} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.MRxldJd6C4bsBo3O]{levitate} with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

Lower Limb Disability.name: Lower Limb Disability
Lower Limb Disability.description:
Due to injury, illness, or incident of birth, you are unable to walk as others do and must rely on some sort of aid for mobility. The cause might include paralysis, amputation of the leg or foot (congenital or acquired), chronic pain, muscular dystrophy, conditions which affect your respiration or balance, or a host of other factors. Because of this, you possess the following traits:

  • You rely on some sort of aid to stand and move. This can include, but is not limited to, crutches, a wheelchair or similar wheeled contraption, or a mechanical or magical apparatus that helps support your weight. Work with the GM to decide which sort of aid works best in the campaign world.
  • You can’t take the Dash action on difficult terrain.
  • You have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to knock you prone or move you against your will.

If your mobility disability is ever remedied, such as through the use of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.9kGrFXnLiRg3Xnbo]{regenerate} spell, you lose the benefits of this feat. The GM should discuss with you whether or not removing your disability is appropriate for your character—it is always a possibility, but never a requirement.

Hedge Wizard.name: Hedge Wizard
Hedge Wizard.description:
Unlike ordinary wizards who learn their craft through extensive research and formal training, you discovered arcana on your own, reading what you could find and uncovering deeper magic through experimentation. Self-education is not without its merits, however, for you have become exceptionally well versed in the most fundamental spells: cantrips.

Prerequisites: Spellcasting or Pact Magic feature

Hit Dice: 1d6

Hit Points: 1d6 (4) + your Constitution modifier

Spellcasting

This auxiliary level counts as a level in your Spellcasting or Pact Magic class (if you have a level in such a class) for the purpose of determining your available spell slots. However, it doesn’t advance your spells known and prepared. For example, if you are a Sorcerer 2/Hedge Wizard, you have four 1st-level spell slots and two 2nd-level spell slots, but you only know 1st-level spells.

Cantrip Savant

You learn three cantrips of your choice from the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.QvPDSUsAiEn3hD8s.JournalEntryPage.k7Rs5EyXeA0SFTXD]{wizard spell list}. Use your spellcasting ability for these spells.

Potent Cantrips

You can add your spellcasting ability modifier to the damage you deal with any wizard cantrip.

Zephyr Magic.name: Zephyr Magic
Zephyr Magic.description:
You know the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.icZokbgV1jIMpNCv]{message} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the @UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.tpJDlh8kL3YBqpi2]{feather fall} spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the @UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.UOTYxwZOmdmLQm1x]{gust of wind} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast feather fall or gust of wind with this trait, you can’t cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

Scoundrel.name: Scoundrel
Scoundrel.description:
Whether you made some dastardly friends, discovered a love for illicit substances, or merely decided that the law shouldn’t stand in the way of making some coin, you’re in deep with the criminal underworld. You can probably keep your criminal ties under wraps, but you can’t stop looking over your shoulder for fear that the authorities, or worse, your friends might come calling.

Prerequisites: Have joined a criminal organization

Hit Dice: 1d8

Hit Points: 1d8 (5) + your Constitution modifier

Tools: Thieves’ tools

Skills: Deception, Sleight of Hand, or Stealth

Thieves' Cant

During your training you learned thieves’ cant, a secret mix of dialect, jargon, and code that allows you to hide messages in seemingly normal conversation. Only another creature that knows thieves’ cant understands such messages. It takes four times longer to convey such a message than it does to speak the same idea plainly.

In addition, you understand a set of secret signs and symbols used to convey short, simple messages, such as whether an area is dangerous or the territory of a thieves’ guild, whether loot is nearby, or whether the people in an area are easy marks or will provide a safe house for thieves on the run.

Quick Dodge

As a bonus action, you can evade the attacks of a creature you can see within 5 feet of you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +2 bonus to your Armor Class against that creature’s attacks. You must be unarmored or wearing light armor to use this ability.

Craven

When a creature you can see misses you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to move 5 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.

Two-Headed.name: Two-Headed
Two-Headed.description:
Prerequisites: 1st level only, near-human variant

Like ettins, you have two heads with differing personalities that jointly control your body.

Ability Score Increase. Increase one ability score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 20.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.M6L3IPtB3yvIFZXv]{Two-Heads.} You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the following conditions on yourself: blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.onHsuAAK1rNG9txa]{Wakeful.} Because one of your heads is always awake, you retain consciousness when you take a long rest.

Diminutive.name: Diminutive
Diminutive.description:
Prerequisite: Medium size

You were born much smaller than others of your race, or simply never grew to full stature. You are Small instead of Medium. Additionally, suffer no penalty for squeezing into a space that is only large enough for a Tiny creature.

Sentient Battleaxe.name: Sentient Battleaxe
Sentient Battleaxe.description:
Magic Weapon. The weapon counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage. When you reach 5th level, your bond with the weapon strengthens, and you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. At 11th level, your bond strengthens further, and you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.items-and-spells.Item.yhj7gI0HfsgE6C3m]{Relic Magic.} Your relic weapon has 3 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dawn. When you use the Attack action to make an attack with your relic weapon, you can spend 1 of its charges to make an attack using it as a bonus action.

Additionally, whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can siphon some of the energy into the weapon. The next time you hit a creature with the weapon during the next minute, you deal extra force damage equal to twice the spell’s level.

Sentience. The weapon is a sentient magic item with an alignment and personality determined by the GM. It has an Intelligence of 14, a Wisdom of 14, and a Charisma of 14. The weapon has hearing and darkvision out to a range of 120 feet, and it can speak, read, and understand Common, as well as communicate with you telepathically.

*Foundry Note: the user will have to manually select 'Proficient' on the Proficiency drop down at the top of the Details tab.

Brave.name: Brave
Brave.description: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the frightened condition on yourself.

Teeth.name: Teeth
Teeth.description:
You can manifest teeth of crackling draconic magic, which are natural weapons that you can use to make @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.GsuvwoekKZatfKwF]{unarmed strikes}. On a hit with them, you deal [[/r 1d6]] damage of the type associated with your Draconic Alliance. You can choose to deal piercing damage with your bite. If you already have natural weapons, you can choose to deal the type associated with your Draconic Alliance instead of its normal damage type.

*Foundry Note: the default damage type is Acid, the user will have to update it to match the Draconic Alliance or change the damage to piercing if they want.

Horns.name: Horns
Horns.description: You have horns that you can use to make @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.GsuvwoekKZatfKwF]{unarmed strikes}. When you hit with them, the strike deals 1d6 + your Strength modifier piercing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

Sellsword.name: Sellsword
Sellsword.description:
Blades-for-hire, mercenaries, sellswords; they go by many names. As a somewhat veteran sellsword, you’ve learned that mercenary work is a volatile business from which only the cautious and cunning can hope to profit. You might have established a set of personal rules or superstitions, or simply gathered a raft of tricks to give you the edge when life and death (and profit) are on the line.

Prerequisites: Have completed at least one contract for mercenary work

Hit Dice: 1d10

Hit Points: 1d10 (6) + your Constitution modifier

Bonus Proficiencies

You gain proficiency with the battleaxe, longsword, trident, and warhammer.

Battle Tactics

You learn maneuvers that are fueled by special dice called battle dice.

Battle Dice. You have two battle dice, which are d6s. A battle die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended battle dice when you finish a short or long rest, or when you roll initiative. Once per turn, you can expend a battle die to perform a maneuver of your choice.

Maneuvers. You learn two maneuvers of your choice from among those available to the Captain class or those available to the Grey Watchman subclass of the warden class.

Saving Throws. Some maneuvers require your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver’s effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

Maneuver save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice)

Breather

You can take a breather, 1 minute of downtime during which you compose yourself and mend your wounds. When you do so, you can spend one Hit Die to regain hit points as if you finished a short rest.

Once you use this ability, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Thieves' Cant.name: 盗贼黑话
Thieves' Cant.description:
During your training you learned thieves’ cant, a secret mix of dialect, jargon, and code that allows you to hide messages in seemingly normal conversation. Only another creature that knows thieves’ cant understands such messages. It takes four times longer to convey such a message than it does to speak the same idea plainly.

In addition, you understand a set of secret signs and symbols used to convey short, simple messages, such as whether an area is dangerous or the territory of a thieves’ guild, whether loot is nearby, or whether the people in an area are easy marks or will provide a safe house for thieves on the run.

Spirit Speech.name: Spirit Speech
Spirit Speech.description:
You can cast the @UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.Rzu7nOt0E7ee5qsI]{speak with dead} spell, without requiring a material component. When you cast the spell using this trait, you can ask the corpse a number of questions equal to your proficiency bonus, and you can’t cast the spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast this spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell when you cast it with this trait (choose when you select this race).

*Foundry Note: The user will have to change the ability modifier of the spell when they select this race.

Invisible Cantrips.name: Invisible Cantrips
Invisible Cantrips.description: When you cast a cantrip that requires one or more spell attack rolls, you can disguise its casting (including its spell components) and effects as if it were a melee weapon attack. To do this, you must be holding a melee weapon, and must target a creature within 5 feet of you. You don’t have disadvantage on ranged spell attack rolls using this feature as a result of being within 5 feet of a hostile creature. The effects of the spell are completely invisible, appearing as if you instead delivered a mighty blow with the weapon.

Beast Companion.name: Beast Companion
Beast Companion.description:
Choose a Beast that is no larger than Medium and has a challenge rating of 1/4 or lower. Add your proficiency bonus to the Beast’s AC, attack rolls, and damage rolls, as well as to any saving throws and skills it is proficient in. Its hit point maximum equals the hit point number in its stat block or four times your level, whichever is higher. Like any creature, it can spend Hit Dice during a short rest to regain hit points.

The Beast obeys your commands as best as it can. It takes its turn on your initiative. On your turn, you can verbally command the Beast where to move (no action required by you). You can use your action to verbally command it to take the Attack, Dash, Disengage, or Help action. If you don’t issue a command, the Beast takes the Dodge action. If you gain the Extra Attack feature or another feature that allows you to attack twice when you take the Attack action, you can forgo one of your attacks to command the Beast to take the Attack action.

If you are incapacitated or absent, the Beast acts on its own, focusing on protecting you and itself. The Beast never requires your command to use its reaction, such as when making an opportunity attack.

If the Beast dies, you can obtain a new companion by spending 8 hours training and bonding with a Beast that isn’t hostile to you and that meets the requirements.

Flame Magic.name: Flame Magic
Flame Magic.description:
You know the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.eCPQuQkIabFKTl9u]{produce flame} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.5SuJewoa1CRWaj1F]{burning hands} spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.FjYE214HTERCRZNm]{flaming sphere} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.5SuJewoa1CRWaj1F]{burning hands} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.FjYE214HTERCRZNm]{flaming sphere} with this trait, you can’t cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

Courier.name: Courier
Courier.description:
A trader, a smuggler, or merely a messenger, you have been tasked with traveling to and fro delivering parcels, and have become quite adept at it. You’re quick on your feet and have a second sense for navigation matched only by sailors and compass salesmen, and you carry those advantages with you in adventuring.

Prerequisites: Have been employed as a courier, messenger, navigator, smuggler, or trader

Hit Dice: 1d8

Hit Points: 1d8 (5) + your Constitution modifier

Languages: One of your choice

Tools: Cartographer’s tools, navigator’s tools, one musical instrument of your choice

Able Navigator

You can’t become lost except by magical means.

Beeline

You can take the Disengage action as a bonus action. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Dexterity modifier, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Hustle

When you take the Dash action, your speed increases by an additional 30 feet.

Root Magic.name: Root Magic
Root Magic.description:
You know the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.VzgFzcmocr1X1cp4]{shillelagh} cantrip and can target yourself with the spell, treating one of your limbs as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.nfIRTECQIG81CvM4]{club} for the duration of the spell. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Qf6CAZkc7ms4ZY3e]{goodberry} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting at 5th level, you can cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.JPwIEfgUPVebr5AH]{barkskin} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Qf6CAZkc7ms4ZY3e]{goodberry} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.JPwIEfgUPVebr5AH]{barkskin} with this trait, you can’t cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose one when you select this race).

Entangling Vines | Summer.name: Entangling Vines | Summer
Entangling Vines | Summer.description: Your Entangling Vines can move the target up to 10 feet to an unoccupied space on the ground or on a floor.

Dwarven Toughness.name: Dwarven Toughness
Dwarven Toughness.description: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

Green Skin.name: Green Skin
Green Skin.description:
Prerequisites: 1st level only, near-human variant

Your people metabolize by basking in the sunlight. Aided by your tough, photosynthetic skin, you gain the following racial traits:

Ability Score Increase. Increase one ability score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 20.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.bR5HfNGRbNIy54UA]{Natural Armor.} Your skin acts as a tough natural armor. When you aren’t wearing armor, your base AC equals 12 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield’s benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.JtLaILLCsXrFLnib]{Photosynthetic Resilience.} You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the poisoned condition on yourself. You also have resistance to poison damage.

Heel-Cutter.name: Heel-Cutter
Heel-Cutter.description:
When you make an opportunity attack against a creature, you can expend one battle die to knock the creature off balance, preventing it from escaping. You add the battle die to the attack roll, and on a hit, the target must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, its speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its turn.

*Foundry Note: Default Save DC is Strength, if the user would like to use their Dexterity modifier they will have to change it on the Details Tab.

Soul Twin.name: Soul Twin
Soul Twin.description:
You were born as a pair of soul twins, identical twins that share a single soul and act as an extension of one another. These twins function as a single character with two bodies, which you control.

Actions. Your twins share a single action, bonus action, and reaction between them, each of which can be taken only once by one of the twins on your turn. If you take the Dash, Disengage, Dodge, Help, Hide, Ready, or Search actions, both twins perform the action and gain its benefits.

Attacks. If you take the attack Action to attack with one twin, the other twin can attack as a bonus action. You don’t add your ability modifier to the damage of the bonus attack, unless that modifier is negative. If you’re able to make multiple attacks, you can divide these attacks between the twins.

Hit Points. Soul twins have separate hit points, which are divided between them. At 1st level, each twin has the hit points of a character of the same class. At higher levels, each soul twin’s hit point maximum increases by your Constitution modifier + half a roll of the class’s Hit Die (rounded up). If you use the average value instead of rolling the Hit Die, each twin gains 2 for a d6 class, 3 for a d8 class, 3 for a d10 class, 4 for a d12 class.

When you spend Hit Dice following a short rest, you must spend the dice separately on each twin.

Spellcasting. A pair of soul twins can only concentrate on one spell at a time. However, only one of the twins needs to concentrate on a spell to maintain it. When you cast a spell which requires concentration, you choose which twin is concentrating on it.

When casting a spell, either twin can provide the spell components, and the spell can originate from the twin of your choice.

Magical Effects. If a spell or magical ability affects one soul twin, it affects them both, unless that spell or ability affects hit points, or if the two twins are further than 100 feet apart. In either case, it affects each twin separately.

Conditions. A condition, such as being poisoned or grappled, affects only one twin, even if imposed by a spell.

Death. When a soul twin is reduced to 0 hit points and begins to make death saving throws, the other twin becomes incapacitated and its speed is halved. If a soul twin dies, the other twin quickly begins to deteriorate, and perishes 24 hours later if their partner doesn’t return to life.

Empathic Link. As long as both twins are on the same plane, they can empathetically sense the other’s emotional state. Each twin knows when the other takes damage.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.journals.JournalEntry.1owgaMWM4ifz4txd.JournalEntryPage.aIzbtVkurmaVmQQJ]{Sidebar: Soul Twins}

Windswept.name: Windswept
Windswept.description:
Prerequisites: 1st level only, near-human variant

Carefree and constantly possessed of wanderlust, the extraordinarily pale windswept embody their connection to Elemental Air. Windswept humans are never likely to sleep in the same bed for two nights in a row; they are always moving, always exploring, and always following the wind. You are lighter than a normal human, capable of floating gently on the breeze, and have faint inborn power over the winds, which grant you the following racial traits:

Ability Score Increase. Increase one ability score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 20.

Lightning Resistance. You have resistance to lightning damage.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.4du8Ziape0fGjPEy]{Zephyr Magic.} You know the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.icZokbgV1jIMpNCv]{message} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.pub0OWVEB71XQx1n]{feather fall} spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.FSMy6VAjDnXY9vWz]{gust of wind} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.pub0OWVEB71XQx1n]{feather fall} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.FSMy6VAjDnXY9vWz]{gust of wind} with this trait, you can’t cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

Upcaster.name: Upcaster
Upcaster.description:
Prerequisite: Spellcasting feature

You can expend two spell slots of the same level to create a spell slot that is higher and immediately use this spell slot to cast a spell that you know or have prepared.

Upper Limb Disability.name: Upper Limb Disability
Upper Limb Disability.description:
Due to injury, illness, or incident of birth, you are unable to use your arms as others can. The cause might include partial paralysis, amputation of the arm or hand (congenital or acquired), lack of manual dexterity, arthritis, chronic pain, or a host of other factors.

Even if you are missing an arm or hand, you can still engage in two-weapon fighting or wield a sword and shield at the same time through the use of prosthetics or a mechanical or magical apparatus that helps you grasp and hold objects.

The nature of your limb disability might vary, so you gain one of the following traits of your choice, as appropriate to your disability:

  • You have disadvantage on attack rolls with heavy weapons and Strength checks that require use of your hands.
  • You have disadvantage on attack rolls with finesse and ranged weapons, and Dexterity checks that require use of your hands.

However, your learned resourcefulness knows no bounds. You have advantage on weapon attacks you prepare with the Ready action.

If your limb disability is ever remedied, such as through the use of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.9kGrFXnLiRg3Xnbo]{regenerate} spell, you lose the benefits of this feat. The GM should discuss with you whether or not removing your disability is appropriate for your character—it is always a possibility, but never a requirement.

Conspiratorial.name: Conspiratorial
Conspiratorial.description: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the charmed condition or madness effects on yourself.

Aberrant Spawn.name: Aberrant Spawn
Aberrant Spawn.description:
Prerequisites: 1st level only, near-human variant

You were somehow mutated or created by an aberration, such as an aboleth, and you suffer from strange deformities as a result. Due to these changes, you have the following racial traits:

Ability Score Increase. Increase one ability score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 20.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.XrxtUp2m5C7GF2O5]{Aberrant Mind.} You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the charmed condition on yourself and against any effect that would sense your emotions or read your thoughts.

Psychic Resistance. You have resistance to psychic damage.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.tKqhtNSgABVrWNP8]{Tentacle.} At least one of your limbs is muscular, rubbery, and pliant, acting as a tentacle that you can use to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with it, the strike deals [[/r 1d6]] + your Strength modifier bludgeoning damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

Downcaster.name: Downcaster
Downcaster.description:
Prerequisites: Spellcasting feature or Pact Magic feature

Thanks to study or deep introspection, you have achieved a firm grasp on spellcasting fundamentals, granting you the following benefits:

  • If you learn spells, you learn 4 spells of your choice of 3rd level or lower from your class’s spell list, which don't count against your number of spells known. If you are a wizard, they are added to your spellbook instantly at no cost. These spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.
  • You can use your action to divide a spell slot of 5th level or lower into two or more lower-level spell slots whose combined level is equal to or less than the original slot’s level. Any spell slot you create with this feat vanishes when you recover spell slots after a short or long rest.

Spider Magic.name: Spider Magic
Spider Magic.description:
You know the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.g2u9PYfqWQAyg9OI]{poison spray} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.95K2aUhAGV9qXjnf]{bane} spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.KJRVzeMQXPj8Gtyx]{spider climb} spell with this trait. Once you cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.95K2aUhAGV9qXjnf]{bane} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.KJRVzeMQXPj8Gtyx]{spider climb} with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

Beastman.name: Beastman
Beastman.description:
Prerequisites: 1st level only, near-human variant

With a short tail, coarse fur covering your face, and long teeth and claws, you appear more like a ferocious beast than a man. Perhaps your parentage includes a werecreature or an intelligent beast, granting you the following racial traits:

Ability Score Increase. Increase one ability score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 20.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.bBItmyjW27zABjpV]{Claws.} You have sharp claws that you can use to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals [[/r 1d6]] + your Strength modifier slashing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

Keen Smell. You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made to smell.

Aquanaut.name: Aquanaut
Aquanaut.description:
Prerequisites: 1st level only, near-human variant

One of your parents is a merfolk, or you are distantly descended from the Elemental Plane of Water. Consequently, you have aquatic features like gills, webbed fingers and toes, and fishlike scales, which grant you the following racial traits:

Ability Score Increase. Increase one ability score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 20.

Aquatic. You can breathe air and water.

Finned. You have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

Precognitive.name: Precognitive
Precognitive.description:
Prerequisite: Wisdom 13 or higher

You sometimes feel impressions of events an instant before they happen. When you begin your turn, you can choose to roll [[/r 1d20]] and record the number rolled. The next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw you make before the end of your turn is replaced with this roll. You can use this ability three times and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Clandestine Caster.name: Clandestine Caster
Clandestine Caster.description:
Discretion is the better part of both valor and incredible arcane might. With some canny trickery, you’ve learned to hide your magic in plain sight, where you might pass as a mighty but otherwise unremarkable warrior, until the moment when you have the upper hand.

Prerequisites: Spellcasting or Pact Magic feature

Hit Dice: 1d6

Hit Points: 1d6 (4) + your Constitution modifier

Skills: Arcana or Deception

Spellcasting

This auxiliary level counts as a level in your Spellcasting or Pact Magic (if you have a level in such a class) class for the purpose of determining your available spell slots. However, it doesn’t advance your spells known and prepared. For example, if you are a Wizard 2/Clandestine Caster, you have four 1st-level spell slots and two 2nd-level spell slots, but you only know 1st-level spells.

Invisible Cantrips

When you cast a cantrip that requires one or more spell attack rolls, you can disguise its casting (including its spell components) and effects as if it were a melee weapon attack. To do this, you must be holding a melee weapon, and must target a creature within 5 feet of you. You don’t have disadvantage on ranged spell attack rolls using this feature as a result of being within 5 feet of a hostile creature. The effects of the spell are completely invisible, appearing as if you instead delivered a mighty blow with the weapon.

Subtle Spell

You can cast a spell without any somatic or verbal components.

Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Draconic Alliance.name: Draconic Alliance
Draconic Alliance.description:
When you gain this level, you become allied with an ancient wyrm or an aspect of the dragon god, who grants you a fraction of their power. You gain resistance to the damage type associated with your dragon, as shown on the Draconic Alliance table below.

Quick Dodge.name: Quick Dodge
Quick Dodge.description: As a bonus action, you can evade the attacks of a creature you can see within 5 feet of you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +2 bonus to your Armor Class against that creature’s attacks. You must be unarmored or wearing light armor to use this ability.

utility.condition: You must be unarmored or wearing light armor to use this ability.

Owlbearman.name: Owlbearman
Owlbearman.description:
Prerequisites: 1st level only, near-human variant

You are a hulking thing of feathers, flesh, and fur; half-man, half-bear, and half-owl. None can say for sure what you are, other than the result of some mad wizard meddling in the gods’ domain. You have the following racial traits:

Ability Score Increase. Increase one ability score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 20.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.Tcbo5vzUZ1Xq2Egd]{Beak.} You have a long, hooked beak that you can use to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with it, the strike deals 1d6 + your Strength modifier piercing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.0OyGBpjKbqtwKVJN]{Owlbear Wrestling.} You can attempt to grapple creatures two size categories larger than yourself, and you have advantage on grappling checks you make on your turn against creatures that are at least one size category smaller than you.

Sentient Trident.name: Sentient Trident
Sentient Trident.description:
Magic Weapon. The weapon counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage. When you reach 5th level, your bond with the weapon strengthens, and you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. At 11th level, your bond strengthens further, and you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.items-and-spells.Item.yhj7gI0HfsgE6C3m]{Relic Magic.} Your relic weapon has 3 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dawn. When you use the Attack action to make an attack with your relic weapon, you can spend 1 of its charges to make an attack using it as a bonus action.

Additionally, whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can siphon some of the energy into the weapon. The next time you hit a creature with the weapon during the next minute, you deal extra force damage equal to twice the spell’s level.

Sentience. The weapon is a sentient magic item with an alignment and personality determined by the GM. It has an Intelligence of 14, a Wisdom of 14, and a Charisma of 14. The weapon has hearing and darkvision out to a range of 120 feet, and it can speak, read, and understand Common, as well as communicate with you telepathically.

*Foundry Note: the user will have to manually select 'Proficient' on the Proficiency drop down at the top of the Details tab.

Porterling.name: Porterling
Porterling.description:
Prerequisites: 1st level only, near-human variant

You are a porterling, parented both by a human and either a gnome or a halfling. You stand about as tall as a dwarf, but are far leaner—and if fathered by a gnome, also somewhat top-heavy. Though they are often confused for dwarves, porterlings can only rarely grow large or thick beards. You have the following racial traits:

Ability Score Increase. Increase one ability score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 20.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.jWPpVjJ7YcVAWKo2]{Flexible.} You have advantage on checks you make to escape grapple or to slip bindings.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.IyhWUR2fUS5uprVp]{Springheel Leap.} Whenever you make a long jump or a high jump, you can roll [[/r 1d8]] and add the number rolled to the number of feet you cover, even when making a standing jump. This extra distance costs movement as normal.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.YHGFHx8a5PhIB7KX]{Squeeze.} You suffer no penalty for squeezing into a space that is only large enough for a creature that is one size smaller than you.

Thick-Skulled.name: Thick-Skulled
Thick-Skulled.description: When you take bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage while you have half your hit points or fewer, you can use your reaction to roll a d6 and reduce the damage taken by the number rolled. The damage reduction increases to 1d8 when you reach 5th level, 1d10 when you reach 11th level, and 1d12 when you reach 17th level.

Exotic Mastery.name: Exotic Mastery
Exotic Mastery.description:
Prerequisite: Proficiency with martial weapons

You have trained in the use of unorthodox types of weapons and armor of irregular design. As such, you gain proficiency with @UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.journals.JournalEntry.xrtPXsUv1j9ZjQvY.JournalEntryPage.nOOY7HDZ8QTHSk8w]{exotic armor} and four @UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.journals.JournalEntry.xrtPXsUv1j9ZjQvY.JournalEntryPage.Yi3KEUAyAMIciyp9#exotic-weapon-proficiencies]{exotic weapons} of your choice.

Near-Human Feats.name: Near-Human Feats
Near-Human Feats.description:
Near-humans come in all shapes and sizes and from all walks of life. They are the barest expression of human diversity: human offshoots from all corners of the world. Each near-human must take one of the following feats at 1st level, which helps define their heritage and grants them new racial traits. You can read more about them @UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.journals.JournalEntry.Gga9MPWLg4I92JLQ.JournalEntryPage.hOUi0Wegj6LyIKuA#near-human-feats]{here}.

Covert.name: Covert
Covert.description:
When you are hidden and a creature discovers you with a successful Wisdom (Perception) check, you can reattempt your Dexterity (Stealth) check to hide. On a success, you silently reposition yourself and the creature doesn’t notice you.

Once you use this trait, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Channel Divinity.name: 引导神力
Channel Divinity.description:
You gain the ability to channel divine energy directly from your deity, using that energy to fuel magical effects. You start with two such effects: Faith Healing and Turn Undead.

When you use your Channel Divinity, you choose which effect to create. You must then finish a short or long rest to use your Channel Divinity again.

Some Channel Divinity effects require saving throws. When you use such an effect from this class, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.items-and-spells.Item.arlGNSsH4gu5hjB9]{Faith Healing.} As an action, you can present your holy symbol and touch a willing Humanoid creature to mend its wounds. The creature rolls a number of d8s equal to half your level (rounded down) and regains that many hit points + your Wisdom modifier. This feature has no effect on Undead or Constructs.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.items-and-spells.Item.qu3TU5UBn0M8Ax9B]{Turn Undead.} As an action, you present your holy symbol and speak a prayer censuring the Undead. Each Undead that can see or hear you within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its saving throw, it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage.

A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it can’t willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you. It also can’t take reactions. For its action, it can use only the Dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there’s nowhere to move, the creature can use the Dodge action.

*Foundry Note: The user can track the number of Channel Divinity uses with this feature.

Springheel Leap.name: Springheel Leap
Springheel Leap.description: Whenever you make a long jump or a high jump, you can roll [[/r 1d8]] and add the number rolled to the number of feet you cover, even when making a standing jump. This extra distance costs movement as normal.

Dragon Acolyte.name: Dragon Acolyte
Dragon Acolyte.description:
Dragons strike awe and fear into mere mortals who gaze upon them. Many flee in terror, but a few fall to their hands and knees, pledging themselves to their new draconic masters. Such dragon acolytes learn to emulate the great beasts, and eventually to capture a semblance of draconic that might.

Prerequisites: Allied with a dragon or an aspect of the dragon god

Hit Dice: 1d10

Hit Points: 1d10 (6) + your Constitution modifier

Draconic Alliance

When you gain this level, you become allied with an ancient wyrm or an aspect of the dragon god, who grants you a fraction of their power. You gain resistance to the damage type associated with your dragon, as shown on the Draconic Alliance table below.

When you take the Attack action, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus). A creature takes [[/r 2d8]] damage of the type associated with your Draconic Alliance on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. This damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (3d8), 11th level (4d8), and 17th level (5d8).

Once you use this ability, you can’t use it again until it recharges. Roll [[/r 1d6]] at the start of each of your turns; the ability recharges when you roll a 6.

Claws and Bite

You can manifest claws and teeth of crackling draconic magic, which are natural weapons that you can use to make unarmed strikes. On a hit with them, you deal [[/r 1d6]] damage of the type associated with your Draconic Alliance. You can choose to deal slashing damage with the claws or piercing damage with your bite. If you already have natural weapons, you can choose to deal the type associated with your Draconic Alliance instead of its normal damage type.

Spellblade.name: Spellblade
Spellblade.description:
You’ve learned to meld your strikes with sparks of arcane magic, gaining the following benefits:

  • You gain proficiency with one martial melee weapon of your choice.
  • When you deal bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage with a melee weapon, you can change the damage type to your choice of acid, cold, fire, or lightning damage.
  • You learn two cantrips of your choice from among the following: @UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.items-and-spells.Item.IjsUVc0MZC3WX9U2]{arc blade}, @UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.items-and-spells.Item.wRGjzBvCCmnC6Ruw]{burning blade}, @UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.items-and-spells.Item.pSdWjjTzBmq6ewn6]{caustic blade}, and @UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.items-and-spells.Item.j5PyPwkO5TdTIrAw]{frigid blade}. Typical: Strength +1, Dexterity +1, Intelligence +1

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.SnZyj8hEiFybn0T3]{Ghostly Descent.} You float gently to the ground. At the end of a fall when you aren’t incapacitated, subtract 60 feet from the distance you fell when calculating your falling damage.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.qSfH18o6j2S8a3Wc]{Incorporeal Movement.} You can move through other creatures as if they were difficult terrain. You can also move through solid objects, but your partially material form can’t pass through more than one foot of stone, one inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

If you end your movement occupying the same spot as a solid object or creature, you are immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space that you can occupy and take force damage equal to twice the number of feet you are moved.

Sentient War Pick.description:
Magic Weapon. The weapon counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage. When you reach 5th level, your bond with the weapon strengthens, and you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. At 11th level, your bond strengthens further, and you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.items-and-spells.Item.yhj7gI0HfsgE6C3m]{Relic Magic.} Your relic weapon has 3 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dawn. When you use the Attack action to make an attack with your relic weapon, you can spend 1 of its charges to make an attack using it as a bonus action.

Additionally, whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can siphon some of the energy into the weapon. The next time you hit a creature with the weapon during the next minute, you deal extra force damage equal to twice the spell’s level.

*Foundry Note: the user will have to manually select 'Proficient' on the Proficiency drop down at the top of the Details tab.

Traveler.name: Traveler
Traveler.description:
You hail from a place so far distant that you may never see home again. Perhaps you are lost in the planes of existence, displaced in time, or shunted to a strange new reality. Perhaps your true home merely lies on the other side of the vast ocean. Regardless, you know very little of this land, its history, or its people, and they also know very little of you. This results in the following traits:

  • You have disadvantage on Intelligence (History) checks pertaining to this new land’s history or customs.
  • You can communicate simple ideas to any creature that understands at least one language using universal gestures and some creativity.

Expert.name: Expert
Expert.description:
Diligent research and practice has paid dividends. Through months of effort, you’ve mastered new crafts, honed your skills, trained in combat, or even improved your book smarts.

Prerequisites: None

Hit Dice: 1d8

Hit Points: 1d8 (5) + your Constitution modifier

Tools: One type of artisan’s tools

Languages: One of your choice

Skills: Choose any two

Spellcasting

This auxiliary level counts as a level in your Spellcasting or Pact Magic class (if you have a level in such a class) for the purpose of determining your available spell slots. However, it doesn’t advance your spells known and prepared. For example, if you are a Wizard 2/Expert, you have four 1st-level spell slots and two 2nd-level spell slots, but you only know 1st-level spells.

Expertise

Choose two of your skill proficiencies. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies.

Training

You gain proficiency with any three simple or martial weapons of your choice. Additionally, you gain proficiency with light armor. If you already have proficiency with light armor, you gain proficiency with medium armor instead.

Hunted.name: Hunted
Hunted.description:
You are pursued by those who would kill you on sight or drag you to an ill-fated end. Perhaps you are fleeing the consequences of a terrible crime, or your name is on the lips of an underworld kingpin. The constant paranoia grants you a +5 bonus to your passive Wisdom (Perception) score and allows you to instantly awaken whenever a creature moves within 30 feet of you. However, you rarely sleep soundly. Roll [[/r 1d20]] whenever you take a long rest; on a 1, you instead only gain the benefits of a short rest.

If you are confident that you are permanently freed of your pursuers, such as if you escape to another plane of existence or watch your hunter die, you lose this feat.

Plushie | Geppettin.name: Plushie | Geppettin
Plushie | Geppettin.description:
Plushies, also called raggedies, are any form of stuffed or soft geppettin. Though they often look humanoid, they may also look like animals, monsters, or any other form of anthropomorphic creature.

As a plushie, you have the following racial traits:

Ability Score Increase. Increase one ability score of your choice by 2 and increase a different score by 1, or increase three different scores by 1.

Typical: Dexterity +1, Charisma +2

Creature Type. You are a Humanoid. However, spells and effects that specifically affect Constructs affect you as well.

Size. You are Small.

Speed. Your walking speed is 30 feet.

Darkvision. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it was bright light, and darkness as if it was dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.zkfRRBi4dz4VTM2M]{Construct Anatomy.} You are immune to nonmagical diseases. You don’t need to eat or breathe, but you can ingest food and drink if you wish.

You don’t need to sleep, and magic can’t put you to sleep. You can finish a long rest by spending 4 hours in a motionless state, during which you retain consciousness.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.niT1nVbacfwnvda7]{False Appearance.} While you are motionless, you are indistinguishable from an ordinary stuffed doll.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.RHAgnCDL4yBls7oI]{Adorable.} You gain proficiency in the Persuasion skill, and have advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) rolls you make against children or other humanoids that are fond of cute things.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.XcTb5ygQFXKxqYYb]{Stuffed with Fluff.} When you take bludgeoning damage, you can use your reaction to gain resistance to the damage, and you are also knocked 5 feet away from the source of the damage. You can’t use this reaction if you can’t be knocked away from the source of the damage.

Stheno.name: Stheno
Stheno.description:
Prerequisites: 1st level only, near-human variant

The offspring of medusas—named sthenos—are usually conceived before the mother begins their transformation. With sharp features and a nest of snakes for hair, sthenos can be easily mistaken for their monstrous parent, but possess a gaze that falls short of turning people into stone.

Ability Score Increase. Increase one ability score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 20.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.aUkzgIIsZImm1YHS]{Immobilizing Gaze.} When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an immobilizing gaze. Choose a creature you can see within 60 feet of you that can see you to make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus). A creature that is immune to being restrained automatically succeeds this saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is incapacitated and its speed becomes 0 until the start of your next turn.

You can use your Immobilizing Gaze a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Stoneborn.name: 石像种
Stoneborn.description:
Prerequisites: 1st level only, near-human variant

With cracked and abrasive skin, stoneborn appear as if they were roughly hewn from granite and have similarly rigid personalities. These near-humans are proud of their connection to Elemental Earth and believe themselves conquerors, fated to rule over every stone. You have the following racial traits:

Ability Score Increase. Increase one ability score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 20.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.j4V3mo4kicTrFoAU]{Stony Skin.} You have a +1 bonus to Armor Class.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.ZG6IzgDYM8WhpWBd]{Sure-Footed.} You have advantage on ability checks and saving throws you make to resist being knocked prone or moved against your will.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.cOWirlGgHFnu8xJU]{Oresight.} By placing your hand on natural stone and using your action to focus, you can feel the presence of any natural gems or metals within 100 feet of you.

Mouseling's Sidestep.name: Mouseling's Sidestep
Mouseling's Sidestep.description: When a creature you can see makes an opportunity attack against you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. You can’t use this trait when wearing medium or heavy armor.

utility.condition: When a creature you can see makes an opportunity attack against you

Regenerative.name: Regenerative
Regenerative.description: If any part of your body is amputated, but its amputation doesn’t kill you, you can fully regrow that part of your body in 24 hours.

Adorable.name: Adorable
Adorable.description: You gain proficiency in the Persuasion skill, and have advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) rolls you make against children or other humanoids that are fond of cute things.

Hexer.name: Hexer
Hexer.description:
Prerequisite: Charisma 13

You learn two @UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.valdas-classes.Item.3XchnhKWbiqpk0Lz]{hexes} of your choice from among those available to the witch class, and gain the @UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.valdas-classes.Item.lHtW1V3PtDx3xfMr]{Cackle} feature from the witch class. Use your Charisma when determining the attack rolls and saving throws of these hexes.

Unarmed Strike | Pugilist.name: Unarmed Strike | Pugilist
Unarmed Strike | Pugilist.description:
Your body is a single deadly weapon, more dangerous and versatile than any sword or arrow. You gain the following benefits:

  • Your unarmed strikes deal 1d6 bludgeoning damage. This damage increases to 1d8 when you reach 5th level, 1d10 when you reach 11th level, and 1d12 when you reach 17th level.
  • When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can use your bonus action to add an extra unarmed strike damage die to the damage roll.

Sentient Flail.name: Sentient Flail
Sentient Flail.description:
Magic Weapon. The weapon counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage. When you reach 5th level, your bond with the weapon strengthens, and you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. At 11th level, your bond strengthens further, and you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.items-and-spells.Item.yhj7gI0HfsgE6C3m]{Relic Magic.} Your relic weapon has 3 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dawn. When you use the Attack action to make an attack with your relic weapon, you can spend 1 of its charges to make an attack using it as a bonus action.

Additionally, whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can siphon some of the energy into the weapon. The next time you hit a creature with the weapon during the next minute, you deal extra force damage equal to twice the spell’s level.

Sentience. The weapon is a sentient magic item with an alignment and personality determined by the GM. It has an Intelligence of 14, a Wisdom of 14, and a Charisma of 14. The weapon has hearing and darkvision out to a range of 120 feet, and it can speak, read, and understand Common, as well as communicate with you telepathically.

*Foundry Note: the user will have to manually select 'Proficient' on the Proficiency drop down at the top of the Details tab.

Rt4ZDmlVWhewFKR4.name: 施法
Rt4ZDmlVWhewFKR4.description: This auxiliary level counts as a level in your Spellcasting or Pact Magic class (if you have a level in such a class) for the purpose of determining your available spell slots. However, it doesn’t advance your spells known and prepared. For example, if you are a Wizard 2/Cultist, you have four 1st-level spell slots and two 2nd-level spell slots, but you only know 1st-level spells.

Speak with Dead | Spirit Speech.name: Speak with Dead | Spirit Speech
Speak with Dead | Spirit Speech.description:
You grant the semblance of life and intelligence to a corpse of your choice within range, allowing it to answer the questions you pose. The corpse must still have a mouth and can't be undead. The spell fails if the corpse was the target of this spell within the last 10 days.

Until the spell ends, you can ask the corpse up to five questions. The corpse knows only what it knew in life, including the languages it knew. Answers are usually brief, cryptic, or repetitive, and the corpse is under no compulsion to offer a truthful answer if you are hostile to it or it recognizes you as an enemy. This spell doesn't return the creature's soul to its body, only its animating spirit. Thus, the corpse can't learn new information, doesn't comprehend anything that has happened since it died, and can't speculate about future events.

Foundry Note: When you cast the spell using @UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.7UZ5EapElyJUMdu5]{Spirit Speech}, you can ask the corpse a number of questions equal to your proficiency bonus, and you can't cast the spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast this spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

Sentient Morningstar.description:

When you reach 5th level, your bond with the weapon strengthens, and you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. At 11th level, your bond strengthens further, and you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon.

Ghostly Descent.name: Ghostly Descent
Ghostly Descent.description: You float gently to the ground. At the end of a fall when you aren’t incapacitated, subtract 60 feet from the distance you fell when calculating your falling damage.

Able Navigator.name: Able Navigator
Able Navigator.description: You can’t become lost except by magical means.

Prophesied.name: Prophesied
Prophesied.description: Your future—or at least a moment of it—has been precisely foretold. Perhaps a fortune-teller saw into your future and told you the exact moment of your death, or maybe you were born in accordance with a great prophecy that will unveil itself throughout your life. Choose the prophecy that has been made of your future and share it with the GM. If or when this prophecy comes true, you do not roll attack rolls, ability checks, or saving throws for the duration of the prophesied events, as they have already been fixed; the GM decides the results of your rolls instead.

Beak.name: Beak
Beak.description: You have a long, hooked beak that you can use to make @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.GsuvwoekKZatfKwF]{unarmed strikes}. When you hit with it, the strike deals 1d6 + your Strength modifier piercing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

Breather.name: Breather
Breather.description:
You can take a breather, 1 minute of downtime during which you compose yourself and mend your wounds. When you do so, you can spend one Hit Die to regain hit points as if you finished a short rest.

Once you use this ability, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Troll-Blooded.name: Troll-Blooded
Troll-Blooded.description:
Prerequisites: 1st level only, near-human variant

With their green-tinted and boil-ridden skin, spindly fingers, and pointed teeth, few people will mark troll-blooded individuals as half-human. These humans exclusively favor the look of their troll parentage and have immense difficulty in human society. You have the following racial traits:

Ability Score Increase. Increase one ability score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 20.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.OtnnCeuKMEceE61p]{Troll Regeneration.} You retain some of the regenerative properties of your troll parentage. You regain 1 hit point each minute if you have no more than one-fourth of your hit points (rounded down) left. You can’t use this trait if you have 0 hit points.

Brutal Grip.name: Brutal Grip
Brutal Grip.description:
You’ve learned to use the weight of your weapons effectively, and have adapted to using large weapons in one hand.

  • Increase your Strength score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • When wielding a versatile weapon in one hand, you may use the two-handed damage die.
  • You can wield a two-handed melee weapon in one hand, treating it as a one-handed weapon. You have disadvantage on attack rolls made when wielding a two-handed weapon this way.

Gust of Wind.name: 造风术
Gust of Wind.description:
一道 60 尺长、10 尺宽的强风线以你为起点向你指定的方向喷涌而出，并持续至法术终止。任何在线状区域内开始其回合的生物必须进行一次力量豁免，豁免失败则被沿着风向推离你 15 尺远。

任何在线状区域内的生物若试图向你移动，每移动 1 尺必须消耗 2 尺移动力。

强风能驱散毒气或蒸汽，并熄灭区域内的蜡烛、火把及其他类似无防护的火焰。对有防护的火焰（如提灯），则使其剧烈摇曳且有 50% 几率熄灭。

在法术终止前的每回合，你可以用一个附赠动作改变风道的方向。

Mandrake.name: Mandrake
Mandrake.description:
Because you are neither beast nor plant, you have the following characteristics:

Ability Score Increase. Increase one ability score of your choice by 2 and increase a different score by 1, or increase three different scores by 1.

Typical: Constitution +1, Wisdom +2

Creature Type. You are a Humanoid. However, spells and effects that specifically affect Plants affect you as well.

Size. You are Medium.

Speed. Your walking speed is 30 feet.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.yjq62sxHULO2hrLS]{Plant Nature.} Even though you are not fully a plant, you still possess many of the same traits as one. As long as you are in direct sunlight for at least 4 hours a day, you don’t need to eat. Additionally, you can breathe through your leaves and extremities and you can absorb water and nutrients through your feet.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.lYzX8SxiFmAYOBrJ]{Emissary of the Trees.} You are proficient in the Nature skill. Additionally, you have advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks you make to interact with Beasts and Plants.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.8tXW3Atp9HqvP2Ga]{Root Magic.} You know the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.VzgFzcmocr1X1cp4]{shillelagh} cantrip and can target yourself with the spell, treating one of your limbs as a club for the duration of the spell. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Qf6CAZkc7ms4ZY3e]{goodberry} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting at 5th level, you can cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.JPwIEfgUPVebr5AH]{barkskin} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast goodberry or barkskin with this trait, you can’t cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose one when you select this race).

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.avvWJbSWY4znj5I2]{Entangling Vines.} You can use your bonus action to cause grasping weeds and vines to sprout up from the ground around a Large or smaller creature you can see within 30 feet. Until the end of the creature’s next turn, its speed becomes 0 and can’t increase. This effect ends early if the creature takes the Disengage action. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

When you reach 3rd level, your Entangling Vines gain an additional effect based on the season in which you were harvested (choose when you select this race):

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.ia7VLjvTq4WN3nXw]{Spring.} Your Entangling Vines can target an airborne creature within 30 feet of the ground, which is pulled safely to the ground when you use this trait.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.AB2Vo6xlUjQ8nb3z]{Summer.} Your Entangling Vines can move the target up to 10 feet to an unoccupied space on the ground or on a floor.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.wxHqi1n3g9n5yIdw]{Autumn.} Your Entangling Vines can affect a second creature within 5 feet of the first target.

@UUID[Compendium.mage-hand-press-valdas-spire-of-secrets.races-and-feats.Item.fNF31DwnqvyDYWnL]{Winter.} The target takes cold damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

Entangling Vines.hint: When you reach 3rd level, your Entangling Vines gain an additional effect based on the season in which you were harvested (choose when you select this race):

Monstrous Strength.name: Monstrous Strength
Monstrous Strength.description: You gain proficiency in the Athletics skill. Additionally, when you make a Strength (Athletics) check, you can treat the result as a 10, or your level plus your Strength modifier, whichever is higher.

Bulwark.name: Bulwark
Bulwark.description: When you hit a creature with a melee attack, you can expend a battle die as a bonus action to brace yourself for its counterattack. The next time you take damage from that creature before the start of your next turn, you can roll the battle die and reduce the damage you take by the number rolled.
